name: @microfox/google-calendar
title: Google Calendar
description: A TypeScript SDK for interacting with the Google Calendar API.

readme_map.description: The full README for the Google Calendar

keyInstructions.setupInfo:
To use this SDK, you need to set up a Google Cloud project and obtain OAuth 2.0 credentials:

1. Go to the Google Cloud Console (https://console.cloud.google.com/).
2. Create a new project or select an existing one.
3. Enable the Google Calendar API for your project.
4. Create OAuth 2.0 credentials (client ID and client secret) for a Web application.
5. Set up the OAuth consent screen and add the necessary scopes.

Environment variables:
- GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID: Your Google OAuth 2.0 client ID
- GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET: Your Google OAuth 2.0 client secret
- GOOGLE_REDIRECT_URI: The redirect URI for your application
- GOOGLE_ACCESS_TOKEN: The OAuth 2.0 access token (optional, can be provided in the SDK constructor)
- GOOGLE_REFRESH_TOKEN: The OAuth 2.0 refresh token (optional, can be provided in the SDK constructor)

Make sure to keep your credentials and tokens secure and never expose them in client-side code.
